html: Year-round sale of E15 is now permissible - it’s long overdue & will not only provide relief to our farmers, but also help families save at the pump. It will strengthen our homegrown energy economy, help us utilize more homegrown biofuels, & decrease dependence on foreign energy.
text: Year-round sale of E15 is now permissible - it’s long overdue & will not only provide relief to our farmers, but also help families save at the pump. It will strengthen our homegrown energy economy, help us utilize more homegrown biofuels, & decrease dependence on foreign energy.

html: Yesterday @SenTinaSmith & I introduced a resolution for the 10th anniversary of the Paul Wellstone & Pete Domenici Mental Health Parity & Addiction Equity Act. We honor Paul’s legacy and his work that has changed the lives of millions of Americans living with mental illness.

html: My mom taught 2nd grade until she was 70 & her favorite unit to teach was on monarch butterflies. Today John & I visited the Pollinator (Butterfly) Garden in Golden Valley near where she lived. html: As I said today, the Constitution doesn’t say, ‘We the ruling party.’ It says ‘We the people.’ If the people of this country want a check & balance & a fair process, we need to speak out. Today we did and I thank Sen. Flake for joining our call to reopen the FBI background check
text: As I said today, the Constitution doesn’t say, ‘We the ruling party.’ It says ‘We the people.’ If the people of this country want a check & balance & a fair process, we need to speak out. Today we did and I thank Sen. Flake for joining our call to reopen the FBI background check

html: Flake just said he wants a week delay of floor vote for a limited investigation. We have been out negotiating for past hour with Chris Coons and others. Due diligence. It is what I asked for in my remarks.
text: Flake just said he wants a week delay of floor vote for a limited investigation.  We have been out negotiating for past hour with Chris Coons and others. Due diligence.  It is what I asked for in my remarks.

html: If the White House would have allowed FBI background check to be reopened & an investigation like in other cases, they wouldn’t have been surprised by answer to: Why did you take the polygraph test in a hotel room in Maryland? Her answer? Because I was at my grandma’s funeral.

html: I got the polygraph test Dr. Ford took showing truthfulness about her account in the record. To quote a judge: “law enforcement agencies use polygraphs to test the credibility of witnesses” & the tests “serve law enforcement purposes.” That judge was Brett Kavanaugh in 2016 case.
text: I got the polygraph test Dr. Ford took showing truthfulness about her account in the record. To quote a judge: “law enforcement agencies use polygraphs to test the credibility of witnesses” & the tests “serve law enforcement purposes.” That judge was Brett Kavanaugh in 2016 case.

html: It was good to hear Dr. Ford’s explanation of why she decided to send the letter in and why she waited before going public: because she was afraid of being “personally annihilated.” She went public after reporters came to her house.
text: It was good to hear Dr. Ford’s explanation of why she decided to send the letter in and why she waited before going public: because she was afraid of being “personally annihilated.”  She went public after reporters came to her house.

html: At hearing. Re Chairman’s claims re FBI background checks: My experience has been that for a number of nominees they have withdrawn nominations or we have asked them to based solely on FBI check. FBI finds things out. The White House should let them do that here&finish their job

html: The opioid epidemic is a serious issue impacting millions of Americans. We’ve passed bipartisan legislation to address the crisis, but pharma lobbyists tried to use the legislation to get $4 billion for drug companies. html: Prescription drug costs are skyrocketing. Now drug shortages are causing more price increases. This is not o.k. html: Asked Judge Kavanaugh about campaign finance law today as well as voting rights. These questions couldn't be more important -- too many states have restricted access to voting with new laws that weaken the right to vote and campaign contribution limits have been eroded by Court.
text: Asked Judge Kavanaugh about campaign finance law today as well as voting rights. These questions couldn't be more important -- too many states have restricted access to voting with new laws that weaken the right to vote and campaign contribution limits have been eroded by Court.

html: “A popular Government, without popular information, or the means of acquiring it, is but a prologue to a farce or a tragedy; or perhaps both.” Those are Madison’s words I quoted in the hearing today.

html: News for people over 50: There’s a shortage of the new shingles vaccine. The CDC recommends healthy adults over 50 receive this vaccine since shingles can be painful and can result in lasting nerve pain. I’m calling for action from the drug maker to quickly resolve this problem.

html: The T-Mobile/Sprint merger would combine 2 out of top 4 wireless carriers, raising antitrust concerns. This afternoon I’ll question company leaders at hearing @SenMikeLee & I are chairing about how the proposal could result in higher prices. We need more competition— not less.

html: My mom moved to MN for a good #union teaching job. I know what unions mean to our families-- they help all Americans succeed. Today's decision in Janus v. AFSCME is not the last word. We'll stand with American workers and stand up against this attempt to weaken unions.
